itemDescription: English composer, arranger, conductor, teacher and organist

wikipedia_page.main: Leonard Nowell Fowles (6 October 1870 – 18 January 1939) was an English organist and choirmaster, classical music composer, arranger, teacher, adjudicator and conductor, best remembered for his hymn tunes "Golders Green" and "Phoenix".

response: *Leonard N. Fowles (organist/composer) was organist and choirmaster for the former St John's Wood English Presbyterian Church.

link_mentions.page: List of Royal College of Music people
response: *Leonard N. Fowles (1870–1939), composer, organist and choirmaster
